abstract: The Obama Administration on Friday backed away from what would have been the first government-run insurance program for long-term care.
snippet: The Obama Administration on Friday backed away from what would have been the first government-run insurance program for long-term care.
lead_paragraph: The Obama Administration on Friday announced that it was scrapping the Class Act, the government-run insurance program for long-term care authorized by the Affordable Care Act, essentially because the numbers could not be made to work. Robert Pear reports:
